intro: Neurolaena suriani, commonly known as the Brazilian false mallow, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 3 meters in height, characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in clusters, which are typically visited by bees and other pollinators. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. Neurolaena suriani is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
